User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X; es-ES; rv:1.8.1.2) Gecko/20070219 Firefox/2.0.0.2
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X; es-ES; rv:1.8.1.2) Gecko/20070219 Firefox/2.0.0.2

when i write in a forum, i can't see what im writing, because the cursor dont move enough.also when i'm deleting what i wrote, the text seems to be there (like a ghost) also the words appears over other words, i dont have this problem with safari. i have this bug in this site. here is a screenshot of this site http://img83.imageshack.us/img83/5976/picture1sj0.png, so you can see the error, like i said this only happens with firefox 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.i dont know how to reproduce it, i only get in in a website or forum
2.
3.
Actual Results:  
the texts appear over the other texts and a "text ghost" appears when i delete

comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.text:
This is a mass search for bugs that are in the Firefox General component, are UNCO, and have not been changed for 1000 days and have an unspecified version. 

Reporter, can you please update to Firefox 3.6.10, create a fresh profile, http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/managing+profiles, and test again. If you still see the bug, please update this bug. If the issue is gone, please set the resolution to RESOLVED > WORKSFORME.
comments.raw_text:

comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: No reply from reporter, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.12 or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
comments.text: No reply from reporter, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.12 or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
